node.title: 'I could see he was purple and wasn't breathing'
node.alt: A premature baby with wires and tubes in its nose peeks at the camera
node.description: Rural women are almost twice as likely to give birth prematurely as women who live in major cities — as one Lightning Ridge mother found during her own "very scary situation".
node.content:
["Judy Scott knows all about the challenges facing pregnant women in remote areas. Two hours after giving birth to her first baby, she and her newborn were on an emergency flight to Sydney.\u00a0", "At 27 weeks pregnant, she was not expecting to give birth to son\u00a0Lane\u00a0when she arrived at the multi-purpose health service in outback NSW town Lightning Ridge.", "\"The nurse came out to get me into a wheelchair;\u00a0for some reason she and Mum knew what was happening, but\u00a0I didn't know what was going on,\" Ms Scott said.", "Not long after giving birth, Judy and her baby were whisked away to the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) at Sydney's Nepean Hospital.", "\"I could see he was purple and wasn't breathing, but the doctor put him near my face so I could kiss him,\" she said.", "", "
The Grace Centre\u00a0cares for more than 600 premature newborns, neonates, and critically ill infants each year.(Supplied: Judy Scott)
", "The ABC contacted the Western NSW Local Health District about Judy's story with the aim of speaking to some of the staff who saved her son's life that day.", "After repeated requests, the local health district\u00a0chose not to make any of the nurses or doctors in Lightning Ridge available, saying Judy and baby Lane's story was far from typical.", "But\u00a0as the National Rural Health Commissioner, Associate Professor Ruth Stewart, said in her address to the Rural Press Club this month, remote women were almost twice as likely to give birth prematurely as women in major cities.", "The realities of rural health have been laid bare in the NSW inquiry into regional health services.", "It showed how long distances make\u00a0it difficult for remote women to access maternity services and specialist care.", "But, as Judy would argue, that doesn't reflect the quality and commitment of rural nurses and doctors.", "\"It was a very scary situation for both of us, but they did an amazing job ... as soon as the doctors were called, they were there so fast,\" she said.", "\"Four nurses, a retired midwife was called in ... they were amazing.\"", "", "
Not long after giving birth in Lightning Ridge, Judy and her baby were relocated to the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) at Sydney\u2019s Nepean Hospital.(Supplied: Judy Scott)
", "Lane was ultimately transferred to the Grace Centre at the Children's Hospital, Westmead, for lifesaving surgery on his abdomen.", "The Grace Centre is a specialist\u00a0unit that cares for more than 600 premature newborns, neonates, and critically ill infants with complex medical conditions each year.", "", "
Lane was\u00a0transferred to the Grace Centre at The Children\u2019s Hospital Westmead for lifesaving surgery on his abdomen.(Supplied: Judy Scott)
", "Westmead NICU nurse Jane Caballero said that her priority was to look after babies like Lane, but a big part of doing so is providing emotional support to the families.", "\"We treat babies from across Australia and the Pacific Rim region,\" Ms Caballero said.", "\"We become like a second family, helping them understand the baby's condition and medical care,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Ms Scott and her partner have been travelling back and forth between Lightning Ridge and Sydney.(Supplied: Judy Scott)
", "For Judy, the experience of becoming a mum to Lane has changed her more than she\u00a0imagined.", "\"It's bad that it takes having a sick son to realise, but you really don't know about the NICU until you've been there,\" she said.", "\"I've even thought to myself, this might be my career ...\u00a0 I might become a nurse in the NICU.\""]
